chargeHist.descr: Purchase Pseudoephedrine for Another with Intent/Facilitate Another Person's Manufacture of Meth

result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald A. Ross Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Purchase Pseudoephedrine for Another with Intent/Facilitate Another Person's Manufacture of Meth, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.453(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

In 15cf15, Court/Michlig statement to time served. Court finds credit of 90 days in 15cf47 and grants an additional 2 days credit on Count 2 and Judgment of Conviction should be amended. In 15cf15, Court finds 14 days credit exists and Judgment of Conviction should be amended - 14 days credit is for revocation of probation not to be credited on current sentence. Adj. 9:49 a.m.

records.addlTxt:
04:31 pm - Defendant Ronald A. Ross in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Defendant Ronald A. Ross in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15cf83, 15cf47, 14cm367,14cm178 (RH), 15cf15 and 14cf217.  In case 14cm367 - State moves to Dismiss and Read In Counts 2 and 3 - Granted.  In Case 14cf217 - State moves to dismiss and read in Counts 3 through 6 - Granted.  In case 15cf15 - State moves to Dismiss but Read In Counts 2 and 3 - Granted.  In Case 15cf47 - State moves to dismiss but read in Coun1 - Granted.  In case 15cf83 - State moves to dismiss but read - Granted.  Defendant pleads no contest to all remaining counts.   Court reads on waiver of rights and tendering plea. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that a factual basis for the plea exists and finds defendant guilty.  Bednar/Bennett/Court statement to sentencing.
Court Sentence
14cm367 - WHS/POP 2 yrs, Jail 45 days all but 14 days stayed with successful completion of OWI Court, W/Huber for all purposes, Fine $1694.00, DL Revocation 24 months, IID 12 months, Alcohol Assessment/Driver Safety Plan, Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO.
14CF217 - Count 1 - WSP 4 yrs - 2 yrs Initial Confinement, 2 yrs Extended Supervision - Imposed and Stayed - Probation 4 yrs - CC/Supervision Fees, Comply with all child support orders, Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
Count 2 - WHS/POP 4 yrs, CC/Supervision Fees, Comply with child support orders, Any other conditions/counseling deemed appropriate by PO
15cf15 - WHS/POP 3 yrs, CC/Supervision Fees, May not possess or purchase pseudephedrine unless possession and/or purchase is pursuant to a valid prescription written for defendant, AODA assessment and recovery, Community Service 50 hours.
15cf47 Count 2 - Jail 1 yr W/Huber for all purposes - CS to 14cm367 - Jail credit 88 days
Count 3 - WHS/POP 4 yrs, CC/Supervision Fees, May not possess or purchase pseudephedrine unless possession and/or purchase is pursuant to a valid prescription written for defendant.
Appeal rights and NADVI given
Called w/15cf83.

09:05 am - Defendant Ronald A. Ross in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Defendant Ronald A. Ross in custody.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15cf15, 14cm367, 15cf83, 14cm178, 14cf217 and 15cf47.  Will proceed with AIA in case 15cf83.  In receipt of complaint, waive reading - set for preliminary hearing.
Bail continued.  Status Conference scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
States Reply to Discovery  and State's Demand for Discovery

11:34 a.m. Defendant Ronald A. Ross in court, in custody, with attorney Brian F. Bennett. Jodie L. Bednar-Clemens, Asst. D.A., appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Calling 15CF47, 15CF15, 14CM367, 14CF217,14CM178. Information filed in 15CF15. State proceeds with preliminary hearing in 15CF47. State calls Officer Kyle Parish, ONSO, sworn, direct. State's Exh. 1 (certified copy of bond in 15CF15) marked, offered, received. State's Exh. 2 (part of facebook page/text & photo) marked, offered, received. Witness identifies defendant. Cross by Bennett. Statement by Bennett. Court statement--finds probable cause exists and binds defendant over for trial. Bennett speaks to possible global resolution; requests further hearing date. Bennett speaks to bond modification. State has no objection to lowering cash bond. Court statement--denies bond modification. 

15CF15 arraignment - Bennett in receipt of Information; waives reading; defendant pleads not guilty on all counts. PTC scheduled at same time as above case.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 20, 2015 at 11:30 am.

03:43 pm - Defendant Ronald A. Ross in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Steven Mitchell Michlig appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing. Waiver free and voluntary. Court finds that probable cause exists and binds over.  Bennett addresses no contact provision of bond in 15cf15 with Andi Hanson - Court denies request to lift the no contact provision.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for February 17, 2015 at 11:30 am.
No contact with co-defendant J.H., A.H., An.He., R.N, no intoxicants and no taverns

4:03 p.m. Defendant Ronald A. Ross in court, in custody, with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Michael William Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Also calling 14CF217, 14CM178. Schiek statement--unable to contact subpoenaed witness/non-appearance; requests adjournment within time limits. Bennett statement--available on Friday only; speaks to bond/indigency. Court statement--questions defendant as to ability to pay outstanding fine/child support/bond modification. Ross statement. Bennett/Schiek statement--concedes officer is not available. Court modifies cash bond to $2,500 signature bond; extends payment in 14CM178. Bennett waives time limits. 14CF217 status on same date. 14CM178 extension granted/status set for same date.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

03:44 pm - Defendant Ronald A. Ross in court with attorney Brian F. Bennett.  Defendant Ronald A. Ross in custody.  Michael W. Schiek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Calling 15cf15 and 14cf217.  In 15cf15 -   In receipt of complaint, waive reading -set for preliminary hearing.  In 14cf217 - An offer has been rec'd - request this case track with 15cf15.  Bennett/Schiek statement to bond modification - requests lifting of the no contact provision.  Court denies motion to modify bond.  Bail continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 28, 2015 at 04:00 pm.
no contact w/co-defendants - J.H., A.H, An.He., R.N., no intoxicants, no taverns

01:57 pm - Defendant Ronald A. Ross in court, in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  In receipt of complaint, right to counsel - defendant will contact PD - Defendant states Bennett represents in underlying cases,  Bednar/Defendant statement to bail - Court sets $ cash bond.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
